alert.note: Alert for Coastal Gulf; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gulf and northwestern Franklin Counties through 315 PM EDT/215 PM CDT/... At 245 PM EDT/145 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of Apalachicola, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Howard Creek, Willis Landing, Buck Siding, Fort Gadsden and White City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Gulf; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf
